get.description: Gets all the details for a specific relation

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the item

parameters.name: Depth
parameters.description: The depth to which the relations are loaded. Depth 2 means that that the relations of relations are also loaded and so on. The default is 1

parameters.name: MaxItemsPerType
parameters.description: The next level of relations is only loaded if at most this number of items of a certain type is present. Otherwise, the tree is cutoff. When this limit is not specified, this call might take a long time if the depth is greater than 1

parameters.name: Include
parameters.description: Comma separated list of the data to include in the response. Supported includes: Relations.OtherItem.*Info to load basic info on the relation target, Relations.OtherItem.*Details to load the details of the relation target, Item.*Info to load basic info on the item for which the relations were requested, Item.*Details to load the details of the item for which the relations were requested

parameters.name: Fields
parameters.description: The ids of the fields which should be included when details are included. When left empty, all fields will be included

testStepId.description: The id of the test step.

ApiAddSingleTestStepResponse.description: Contains information about created test step.

ApiArgumentErrorType.description:
Identifies the type of "argument error" which occurred. 
Argument error is a situation when information received from the caller 
is invalid (e.g. does not fit into expected limits, is of invalid type etc.) 
or does not correspond to system state (e.g. trying to update a locked item). 
Argument errors are not system errors, but rather client errors.

scriptId.description: If not zero indicates that automation script (represented by this object) is referenced from script library.

ApiAutomation.description: Automation part of a test step, as used when loading data.

scriptId.description:
If not zero indicates that automation script (represented by this object) is from script library. 
In such case update is only possible via corresponding Script item, not via Test Case.

ApiAutomationSave.description: Automation part of a test step, as used when saving data.

isNew.description:
Indicates whether data represent a new (transient) content or an update of existing content. 
Should be set to true if we are saving a new automation into step that previously contained any automation already.

message.description: A human-readable description of the error.

code.description: The error code to be used for tracking the error a the server side.

furtherInfo.description:
Further information about the error as unstructured text. This text is
not localized.

errorData.description: Additional data about the error (if any). Depends on actual error type.

ApiBackendNotAvailableError.description:
This error is returned when the aqua backend is not available. You can wait
a couple of minutes and check if the backend is available again. If not, you
might want to contact your aqua administrator.

value.description:
The value to which the field will be changed. The exact type of the
value depends on the field of the type: 
- for regular fields (UpdateType=RegularField) it should be the same as defined in ApiFieldUpdate.Value
- for differential update of multi-selection fields (UpdateType=MultiChoiceFieldDifferential) it should be an array of ints (ids)
- for a new enclosure (UpdateType=NewEnclosure) it should be string containing plain text of the enclosure content.

updateOnlyIfEmpty.description: Performs update only if the field is currently empty.

ApiBatchFieldUpdate.description: Represents batch update of a single field to a given value.

add.description:
If true, the values of multi-selection field are added to the current set. 
If false, the values are removed.

ApiBatchFieldUpdateMultiChoiceFieldDiffe.description: Represents differential update of a multi-selection field.

ApiBatchFieldUpdateNewEnclosure.description:
Represents a special type of update that creates a new defect enclosure.
Valid only for defects.

fieldId.description: Id of the regular field to update.

ApiBatchFieldUpdateRegularField.description: Represents update of a "regular" field i.e. field which is editable in the edit mask (see project meta).

ApiEditableInfo.description: Contains information about editable status of an item.

creationDate.description: The date when the enclosure has been created.

message.description: A human-readable description of the error.

code.description: The error code to be used for tracking the error a the server side.

furtherInfo.description:
Further information about the error as unstructured text. This text is
not localized.

errorData.description: Additional data about the error (if any). Depends on actual error type.

ApiError.description: Contains information about an error which occurred during an API call.

mandatory.description:
Indicates that the field must be set to the default value. The field
is fixed to this exact value.

ApiFieldDefaultValue.description: Contains the default value for certain field.

possibleValues.description:
The list of values which are allowed for this field. The list contains
different types of values depending on the field type. Null means that
all values which fit the field type are allowed.
This list of values is based on the project template and on the workflow.
These values might be restricted further by the Rules which are included
in this editmeta as well.

allowOtherValues.description:
Indicates whether the field allows ohter values which are not included in the
PossibleValues as long as they are fit the field type.

required.description:
Indicates that the field is required which means that it must
have a nonempty value.

readonly.description:
Indicates that the field is readonly and cannot be modified
by the user.

rules.description:
A list with additional rules which apply to this field. The client is responsible
for evaluating these rules as necessary when fields change. These rules might
further restrict the list of possible values.

fieldMask.description: Contains formatting information for a specific field.

visible.description:
Indicates whether the item should be visible in a UI. The visibility
of the field might depend on the item's status when a workflow is active.
In this case, the field will still have valid index.

highlight.description: Indicates that the field should be highlighted in the UI.

ApiFieldEditMeta.description:
Contains the information for a specific field of an item including
the field's value.

id.description:
The id of the field. The field id is identical to the internal property name. Therefore, it is
only unique in scope of the same project and item type.

title.description: Title of this field, as visible in the UI. Can be customized by in project configuration.

isCustom.description: True if this field is a custom field.

isGroupableInCharts.description: True if the field can be used as GroupBy or XAxis property on a chart (dashbaord).

supportsFieldRules.description: Indicates whether this field supports field rules.

supportedFilterOperations.description:
Contains a list of all filter operators which are supported
for this field.

isFilterable.description:
Indicates whether it is possible to filter by this field e.g.
in item lists.

isSortable.description:
Indicates whether it is possible to sort by this field e.g.
in item lists.

isAffectable.description: Indicates whether it is possible to affect this field by field rules.

isGroupable.description:
Indicates whether it is possible to group by this field e.g.
in item lists.

isActive.description: Indicates whether the field is currently enabled or disabled.

supportsBatchUpdate.description:
Indicates whether the field supports batch updates in general. Depending on the
concrete items and the configured workflow, it might still not be possible to change
a value even if the field supports batch updates in general.

ApiFieldMeta.description: Contains the meta-information of a specific field.

ApiFieldMetaDateTime.description: Contains the meta-information of a date time field.

ApiFieldMetaDecimal.description: Contains the meta-information of a decimal field.

isShared.description: Indicates if the field value set is shared.

ApiFieldMetaDictionary.description: Contains the meta-information of a (single selection) dictionary field.

id.description:
Id of the entry. This value is stored on actual item that references the dictionary entry.
(entries can be safely renamed, as their ids do not change).

name.description: Name of the dictionary entry. This is the value visible in the UI.

isDefault.description: Indicates whether this entry should be cosnidered as default for this dictionary.

isDeleted.description:
Indicates whether this entry was deleted. 
Deleted entries are not available for selection, but still can seen on old items (edited before teh entry has been deleted).

ApiFieldMetaDictionaryEntry.description: Contains the meta-information of a dictionary entry.

isShared.description: Indicates if the field value set is shared.

ApiFieldMetaDictionaryMultiChoice.description: Contains the meta-information of a (multi selection) dictionary field.

ApiFieldMetaFlag.description: Contains the meta-information of a flag field.

ApiFieldMetaId.description: Contains the meta information of an Id field

ApiFieldMetaJson.description: Contains the meta-information of a string field.

ApiFieldMetaSprint.description: Contains the meta-information of a sprint field.

ApiFieldMetaString.description: Contains the meta-information of a string field.

ApiFieldMetaStringAutoComplete.description: Contains the meta-information of a auto-complete string field.

ApiFieldMetaStringList.description: Contains the meta-information of a list of strings.

ApiFieldMetaTimeSpan.description: Contains the meta information of a timespan field

ApiFieldMetaUser.description: Contains the meta-information of a (single selection) user field.

ApiFieldMetaUserMultiChoice.description: Contains the meta-information of a (multi selection) user field.

placeholder.description: The placeholder text for this field

title.description: The field title for UI purposes

fieldId.description: The internal Id for the field.

ApiFieldPlaceholder.description:
A placeholder field to be replaced with a value from the
TestCase on test execution

min.description: If the field has the type decimal, this field contains the minimal value.

max.description: If the field has the type decimal, this field contains the maximal value.

guid.description: The unique id of the field rule.

fieldId.description: The id of the field to which the rule applies.

ApiFieldRule.description: Represents a single rule for a field.

otherFieldId.description: The id of the other field on which the field to which this rule applies depends.

restrictions.description: The list with the restrictions for the value of the field.

ApiFieldRuleDependentValues.description:
A field rule which defines a dependency between to dictionary fields. Values
of the field with the id ```FieldId``` are only allowed for certain
values in the field with the id ```OtherFieldId```.

transitions.description:
The list of transitions which this rule defines. Each transition
specifies a list of actions which should be performed when the
field is changed to the specified value.

ApiFieldRuleWorkflow.description:
This field rule allows to specify actions which are performed
when a dictionary field is changed to a certain value.

fieldId.description: This action is applied to the field with this id.

readonly.description: Indicates whether the field should be readonly.

required.description: Indicates whether the field should be required.

visible.description: Indicates whether the field should be visible.

highlight.description: Indicates whether the field should be highlighted.

changeValue.description: Indicates whether the value of the field should be changed.

ApiFieldRuleWorkflowActions.description: Contains the actions which should be performed for one specific field.

actions.description:
The list of actions which are executed when the value of the
dictionary field is changed to the specified value.

ApiFieldRuleWorkflowTransition.description:
Contains all the actions which should be performed when the dictionary
field is changed to the specified value.

ApiFieldSortMode.description: The different modes in which the list of fields can be sorted.

text.description: A human-readable representation of the field value.

ids.description: The list of field value ids.

values.description: The list of field value names.

ApiFieldValueDictionaryMultiChoice.description:
The value of a multi choice dictionary field. Contains the value
both as list of ids and list of names.

isAssignable.description:
Indicates whether the field value is assignable. 
By 'assignable' we mean it is possible (currently) to change value of a field into this value
(in case of multi-selection it means the corresponding option can be activated).
Field values become unassignable when they are deleted.

isDeleted.description: Indicates whether the field value has been deleted.

ApiFieldValueDictionaryWithSelectionInfo.description:
This model extends the dictionary value model with additional information regarding
the selectability of the value.

allowedFor.description:
The values of the other field for which the specified
value is allowed.

ApiFieldValueRestriction.description: The restriction for certain field value.

html.description:
The rich text contained in the field as HTML. The HTML includes
pictures as img tags.

values.description: The list of field value names.

ApiFieldValueStringList.description:
The value of a multi choice dictionary field. Contains the value
both as list of ids and list of names.

value.description:
The value of the given time span. The base unit is
given separately.

ApiFieldValueTimeSpan.description: A time span which consists of a value and a unit.

value.description:
The value of the given time span. The base unit is
given separately.

ApiFieldValueTimeSpanUpdate.description: Contains the necessary data to update a timespan field to a new value.

values.description: The list of users. Contains more information on each user.

isAssignable.description:
Indicates whether the user is assignable. 
By 'assignable' we mean it is possible (currently) to change value of a field into this value
(in case of multi-selection it means the corresponding option can be activated).
Users might be become unassignable when they are deleted, deactivated or
unassigned from the project.

isDeleted.description:
Indicates whether the user has been deleted. Deleted
users have their information blanked out.

ApiFieldValueUserWithSelectionInfo.description:
This model extends the user value model with additional information regarding
the selectability of the value.

expression.description: The filter expression as JSON structure.

ApiForbiddenError.description:
This error is returned when the current user is not allowed to perform the
requested operation.

ApiForbiddenErrorType.description: The different reasons why a Forbidden error might occur.

added.description:
The list of names of the attachments which were added
to the item

removed.description:
The list of names of the attachments which were removed
from the item

ApiHistoryAttachments.description: The list of changes to the attachments of an item.

ApiHistoryCreationMode.description: Identifies how the item was created

ApiHistoryDependencyChangeType.description:
Indicates the type of change which occurred to a
certain dependency

itemName.description:
The name of the current item at the time when the dependency
has been modified

otherItemName.description: The name of the other item which is part of this dependency

ApiHistoryDependencyChanged.description: Contains information on the dependency which changed.

ApiHistoryEnclosureChangeType.description: Identifies the type of change to a certain enclosure.

id.description:
The id of the changed enclosure. Might be null, if
the id has not been tracked.

ApiHistoryEnclosureChanged.description: Contains the changes to a single enclosure.

id.description: The id of the history entry

timeStamp.description: The date and time when the changes were performed

fields.description: The list of changes to the fields

enclosures.description: A list with all changes to the enclosures of this defect.

ApiHistoryEntryDefect.description:
Contains all changes which were done to a defect in one operation
together with information on when and by whom the defect has been changed.
When no changes of a given type occurred, the corresponding field in
this response will be missing.

ApiHistoryFieldChangeType.description: Identifies the type of change to a certain field

fieldId.description: The id of the changed field

fieldTitle.description: The title of the changed field

oldValue.description:
The old value before the change as human readable object.
If the flag ```IsRichText``` is true the value is of type ```ApiRichText``` otherwise of type ```string```.
ApiRichText contains following information:
- string Html: information rendered as HTML.
- bool IncompatibleRichTextFeatures: Indicates that rich text features are used which are not supported by the REST API.
- string PlainText: information as plaintext.

newValue.description:
The new value after the change as human readable object. 
If the flag ```IsRichText``` is true the value is of type ```ApiRichText``` otherwise of type ```string```.
ApiRichText contains following information:
- string Html: information rendered as HTML.
- bool IncompatibleRichTextFeatures: Indicates that rich text features are used which are not supported by the REST API.
- string PlainText: information as plaintext.

isRichText.description: If true indicates that the values are of type ```ApiRichText```, otherwise of type ```string```.

ApiHistoryFieldChanged.description: A certain field of an item has changed

ApiHistoryItemCreated.description: Information on the creation of the item.

info.description:
Some information provided by the migration tool. Most likely
the name of the third-party system from which the item was migrated
and or its original id.

historyDownloadUrl.description:
A URL where a file with the history of the item in the third-party
system can be downloaded.

ApiHistoryItemMigrated.description: Information on the migration of the item from a third-party system.

oldPath.description: The old path of the item before it was moved

newPath.description: The new path of the item after it was moved

ApiHistoryPostChangeType.description: Identifies the type of change to a certain post

number.description: The index of this post in the list posts of the current item.

mentionedUsers.description:
The list of full names of the users which are mentioned in the post
after the change.

contentTruncated.description: Truncated version of the content as plain text.

ApiHistoryPostChanged.description: Contains the changes to a certain post.

syncModuleId.description:
The id of the sync in which the error occurred. This can be null
for some legacy syncs.

syncModuleType.description: The type of the sync in which the error occurred.

syncName.description: The name of the sync in which the sync error occurred.

isPushError.description:
Indicates whether the sync error occurred during a push or pull.
When true, the error occurred during a push. Otherwise, it occurred
during a pull.

isAutoMergeError.description:
Indicates whether the sync error occurred during an automatic
merge operation. When true, the error occurred during an automatic
merge. Otherwise, it occurred during a normal sync operation.

errorMessage.description: The actual error message provided by the sync for the sync error.

ApiHistorySyncEvent.description:
Contains information about the sync event which has been logged
in the item's history. Connectors which synchronize items in aqua with
third-party systems log their errors and the resolving of the errors
in the history to make them visible to the user.

ApiHistorySyncEventType.description: Indicates the type of sync event.

added.description:
The list of full names of users which were added to the list
of subscribers.

removed.description:
The list of full names of users which were removed from the
list of subscribers.

ApiHistoryUserCCs.description:
Contains the changes to the list of users which have subscribed
to the item and are notified about any changes.

message.description: A human-readable description of the error.

code.description: The error code to be used for tracking the error a the server side.

furtherInfo.description:
Further information about the error as unstructured text. This text is
not localized.

errorData.description: Additional data about the error (if any). Depends on actual error type.

ApiInternalError.description:
An internal error occurred in the REST API. Please ask your
administrator to check the aqua server logs.

formattedId.description:
A nicely formatted version of the id which
contains the item type identifier and the numerical
id padded to six digits. E.g.: RQ004242.
This id is only for presentation. You must use the
numerical id for all requests.

A nicely formatted version of the id which
contains the item type identifier and the numerical
id padded to six digits. E.g.: RQ004242.
This id is only for presentation. You must use the
numerical id for all requests.

archived.description: The archived flag of the item.

hasDependency.description: True if item has any dependency.

hasFiles.description: True if item has any attachments.

ApiItemInfo.description: Contains only the basic information of a specific item.

projectId.description: The id of the project

text.description:
The human readable path as text. The path consists of the project name and
the folder names separated by slashes

path.description: Provides a list of folders with the complete path. The order of items corresponds to the path. The project itself is not contained.

isProjectArchived.description: Indicates whether the project is archived.

ApiItemLocation.description: Specifies the location (project and folder) of an item

archive.description:
If true, the items will be marked as archived. 
If false, the items will be marked as non-archived.

ApiItemLongOperationArchive.description: Represents request to batch archive (or un-archive) items.

targetFolderId.description: Id of the target folder. Use zero for root folder.

ApiItemLongOperationCopyInProject.description: Represents request to copy items to a given folder (in scope of the same project)

targetFolderId.description: Id of the target folder. Use zero for root folder.

ApiItemLongOperationCopyToProject.description: Represents request to copy items to a given folder (in scope of the same project)

ApiItemLongOperationDelete.description: Represents request to batch delete items.

projectId.description: Project where to look in.

ApiItemLongOperationDomain.description: Defines set of items to be processed.

folderId.description: Folder where to look in. Zero means root folder (combined with Recursive=true means all items in project).

recursive.description: If true items in subfolders are considered as well.

includeArchived.description: If true the archived items (matching other criteria) are included as well.

ApiItemLongOperationDomainFilterBased.description: Defines set of items matching a given filter.

ApiItemLongOperationDomainListBased.description: Defines set of items matching a given list of ids.

targetFolderId.description: Id of the target folder. Use zero for root folder.

ApiItemLongOperationMoveInProject.description: Represents request to move items to a given folder (in scope of the same project)

updates.description: List of updates to be applied.

ApiItemLongOperationUpdateProperties.description: Represents request to batch update items (update properties).

canCreateDependentItem.description:
Indicates whether the user is able to create a new dependent item of
a certain type in the same folder as the current item is located in.

ApiItemPermissions.description:
Represents permissions of an item. Intended to be subclassed 
by classes with more fine-grained permission set for given context.

version.description:
The version of the item. This version field is incremented each time
the item is modified.

operationNumber.description:
This field is incremented when the item itself was not modified
but the information in some system-managed fields changed.

subOperationNumber.description:
The same as ```OperationNumber``` but for changes which are
less important and do not increment the operation number.

ApiItemsPatchRequest.description:
Represent a request to modify a bunch of items (of the same type).
Actual subclasses are used, depending on OperationType.

ApiItemsPatchRequestArchive.description: Represents operation that archived (or un-archives) a bunch of items.

ApiItemsPatchRequestCopyInProject.description: Represents operation that copies a bunch of items to a different folder in the same project.

ApiItemsPatchRequestCopyToProject.description: Represents operation that copies a bunch of items to a different folder in the same project.

ApiItemsPatchRequestDelete.description: Represents operation that deletes a bunch of items.

ApiItemsPatchRequestMoveInProject.description: Represents operation that moves a bunch of items to a different folder in the same project.

ApiItemsPatchRequestUpdateProperties.description: Represents operation that updates properties of some items.

id.description: Id of attached label. Does not reference to global label.

ApiMediaTypeNotSupportedError.description:
This error is returned when media type of the request is not supported.
Unless files are uploaded, only the media type application/json is supported.

hasVariables.description: No set if NestedTestCaseAccessibility is set to NoPermissions, true if test case contains any variables otherwise false.

id.description: The id of the nested test case, set the id only if the type is nested test case.

name.description: The name of the nested test case.

ApiNestedTestCaseInfo.description: Contains information about nested test case.

id.description: The id of the nested test case, set the id only if the type is nested test case.

nestedTestCaseValueSetGuid.description: The guid of the value set, set the guid only if the type is nested test case.

ApiNestedTestCaseInfoNew.description: Contains information about nested test case.

nestedTestCaseValueSetGuid.description: The guid of the value set, set the guid only if the type is nested test case.

ApiNestedTestCaseInfoUpdate.description: Contains update information for the nested test case.

ApiNotFoundError.description:
This error is returned when the specified entity or endpoint
does not exist.

number.description: The index of this post in the list posts for the associated item.

dateCreated.description: The date when the post was created.

dateModified.description: The date when the post was last modified.

deleted.description:
Indicates whether the post has been deleted. Deleted posts do not contain any
content but are still included in the list of post for a certain item.

mentionedUsers.description:
The list of users which are mentioned in the post. Users can be mentioned in
a post by using the @username syntax.

ApiPost.description: A post with its full contents and the list of mentioned users.

number.description: The index of this post in the list posts for the associated item.

dateCreated.description: The date when the post was created.

dateModified.description: The date when the post was last modified.

deleted.description:
Indicates whether the post has been deleted. Deleted posts do not contain any
content but are still included in the list of post for a certain item.

ApiPostInfo.description:
This class contains just the basic information on a post but not
its contents or the list of users mentioned in it.

postsTotalCount.description: The total count of posts for this object.

ApiPostPaginated.description: Contains paginated posts with total count of posts.

isOwned.description: Indicates whether the current project owns the project configuration.

isShared.description:
Indicates whether this project configuration is shared between
multiple projects.

ApiProjectConfigInfo.description:
Some basic information regarding the project configuration
(template, etc.).

parentFolderId.description: Folder Id of Parent, '0' means it is a root folder of the given project

ApiProjectFolderItemTypePermissions.description: Represents item-type related permissions in a project folder.

ApiProjectIdName.description: Holds the id and the name of a project.

isArchived.description: True if project was makred as archived.

isFavourite.description: true if project was makred as favourite

hasSubfolders.description: Indicates whether this project has any subfolders.

ApiProjectPermissions.description:
Represents permissions in a project. Includes only project-level permissions. 
For permissions that can be defined on folder level (e.g. permissions to create items) 
please refer to ApiProjectFolderPermissions (this also included a project's root-folder permissions).

parentFolderId.description: Folder Id of Parent, '0' means it is a root folder of the given project

hasSubfolders.description: Indicates whether this folder has any subfolders.

projectId.description: Id of project where folder is located

parentFolderId.description: Folder Id of Parent, '0' means it is a root folder of the given project

hasSubfolders.description: Indicates whether this folder has any subfolders

ApiProjectTreeFolder.description: Holds the folder information required to render a projects/folders tree.

foldersPath.description: Contains folder path, in top-down order.

ApiProjectTreePathResponse.description:
Contains information about requested folder "path" i.e. 
includes project information and information of all parents of a given folder 
up to the top.

hasSubfolders.description: Indicates whether this project has any subfolders

archived.description: Indicates whether this project is archived

ApiProjectTreeProject.description: Holds the project information required to render a projects/folders tree.

url.description: The URL to which the request is redirected.

ApiRedirectResult.description:
This result is returned as part of a redirection response.
Most clients should automatically follow the redirect and
will never see this response.

id.description: The id of the relation itself.

ApiRelation.description:
Represents a relation between to items. These items might belong
 either to aqua or to an external system.

itemExtra.description:
Contains relation-specific data for the source item of
the new relation.

otherItemId.description: The id of the target of the new relation.

otherItemExtra.description:
Contains relation-specific data for the target item of
the new relation.

ApiRelationNew.description: Contains the data necessary to create a new relation.

depth.description:
The depth (number of levels) for which the relations
were requested.

relations.description:
The relations of the items. Might contain several
levels of relations depending on the requested depth.

ApiRelations.description:
Contains the requested relations together with some information
on the item for which the relations were requested.

html.description:
Contains the description rendered as HTML. Images are included with standard image tags.
When sending HTML to server, all images must be uploaded to the server first by posting
to ```/api/Image```. The returned URLs can then be included into the HTML.

incompatibleRichTextFeatures.description:
Indicates that rich text features are used which are not supported by the REST API,
e.g. comments. Information from the rich text might be missing in the HTML and
plain text provided by the REST API. The rich text cannot be modified via the REST API.

plainText.description: Contains the description as plain text. The plain text does not contain any formatting or images.

ApiRichText.description:
Contains some rich text. The rich text is provided in several different formats.
When sending rich text to the server, the rich text must be provided in exactly
one format.

onSuccessOnly.description: Describes if true this is a hard dependency otherwise this is a soft dependency.

maxNumberOfEntries.description:
The maximum number of entries the history can have. The history can
have less entries when the test case or test job has not been executed
that often yet.

ApiTestCaseExecutionHistory.description:
Historic information regarding the last executions
of a test case or test job.

ApiTestCaseExecutionHistoryEntry.description: Contains history information for a single test execution.

ApiTestCaseRunStatus.description: Identifies the status of an execution of a test case.

valueSets.description: The value sets which are part of the test data.

variables.description: The variables which are part of the test data.

values.description:
The actual values contained in the test data. The table
is a two-dimensional array which contains for each value
set a list of values. The data is ordered according to
the ValueSets and Variables list.

fields.description:
The list of fields that can be used as replacement
placeholders in the TestCase

ApiTestData.description: Contains the test data of test case.

isReferenced.description:
If not null, indicates whether this local test data is already referenced by other test cases. 
You need to provide 'IsReferenced' as an option to 'include' parameter in order to 
request initialization of this field.

ApiTestDataLocal.description:
Represents "local" test data (in a test case) i.e. owned by this test case. 
Such test data can be modified in scope of this test case.

referencedTestCaseId.description: Id of the referenced test case test data is shared from.

ApiTestDataReferencedTestCase.description:
Represents "referenced" test data (in a test case) i.e. owned by another test case. 
Such test data cannot be modified in scope of current test case 
(please modify it in context of its owner test case)

guid.description: The GUID of the value set.

name.description:
The name of the value set. Is null, when the
value set has been deleted.

deleted.description: Indicates whether the value set has been deleted.

ApiTestDataReferencedValueSetInfo.description:
Contains the meta data of certain value set which is referenced
somewhere (e.g. test step or test job).

guid.description: The GUID of the value set.

name.description: The name of the value set.

ApiTestDataValueSetInfo.description: Contains the meta data of a certain value set in the test data.

valueSetName.description: The name of the value set.

variables.description:
The variables contained in this value set together with their
values.

ApiTestDataValueSetNew.description:
Contains information about new value set (along with values) 
to be part of test data (of a test case).

valueSetName.description: The name of the value set.

variables.description:
The variables contained in this value set together with their
values.

ApiTestDataValueSetUpdate.description:
Contains information about updated value set (along with values). 
Variables ()number and names) must match existing test data.

ApiTestDataVariable.description: Contains the meta data of a certain variable in the test data.

value.description: The value the variable has in the current value set.

ApiTestDataVariableWithValue.description:
Represents a variable with its value in a certain
value set.

formattedId.description:
A nicely formatted version of the id which
contains the item type identifier and the numerical
id padded to six digits. E.g.: RQ004242.
This id is only for presentation. You must use the
numerical id for all requests.

ApiTestExecutionNewResponse.description: Represents the response for creating new execution, the response depends on the execution context.

ApiTestExecutionNewResponseTestCaseConte.description: Represents the response for creating new test case execution.

testScenarioExecutionId.description: The id of the testscenario execution.

ApiTestExecutionNewResponseTestScenarioC.description: Represents the response for creating new test scenario execution.

index.description:
The index of this execution in the test scenario
execution. The index does not need to be consecutive as partial
execution of a test scenario is allowed.

runDependency.description:
The run dependencies for this execution. The run dependencies
can be defined freely here but are enforced afterwards by the UI
when updating the execution.

testScenarioId.description:
The id of the test scenario in scope of which this execution
is performed.

testJobId.description:
The id of the test job to which this execution belongs. This id is optional
and ids which do not exist anymore will be silently dropped. A valid id needs
to be provided when the last execution information for a test job should be
updated.

ApiTestExecutionNewTestScenarioInfo.description:
Contains information specific for the execution
in scope of a test scenario.

title.description: The title of the execution status.

count.description:
The number of test jobs which reached this status
during their last execution.

percentage.description:
The percentage of test jobs which reached this status
during their last execution.

ApiTestJobStatisticsEntry.description:
Holds statistical information for test jobs with
a single last execution status.

index.description: The index of this test step.

id.description: The id of the test step.

ApiTestStep.description: A persistent test step of a test case.

index.description: The index of this test step.

ApiTestStepNew.description: A new test step of a test case.

ApiTestStepType.description: Identifies the type of an execution.

name.description: Test step name. When the value is null, it will be ignored.

index.description: The index of this test step.

ApiTestStepUpdate.description: Contains update Information for a test step of a test case.

firstName.description: The first name of the user

surname.description: The surname / last name of the user

fullname.description:
The full name of the user. This string is correctly formatted and
should be used when displaying a user e.g. in a list.

email.description: The email address of the user

phone.description: The phone number of the user

position.description: The position of the user in the company

pictureUrl.description:
The absolute url of the user's picture. Might be null, if
the user does not have a picture assigned.

longRunningTaskGuid.description:
Id of the long running task. Can be used to query the progress (see GET /System/LongOperation/{guid}). 
If empty indicates the long operation has not been started and actual result is immediately available in the Result field.

result.description: Filled only when LongRunningTaskGuid is not provided. Contains actual, immediate result of the call.

BooleanApiLongOperation.description:
Result of a REST API call that started long operation (asynchronous) to perform the actual job. 
When LongRunningTaskGuid is null this indicates a situation when REST API was able to process the task without starting asynchronous job. 
Then the actual result is returned in Result field.

nextVersionBaseObjectId.description:
If any new version of this item has been created, then this field contains reference 
to that new version. In case when several new versions have been created from this item 
(a.k.a. branching) then this field contains a reference to most recently created item. 

Note: this field can be updated without increasing Version field.

originalBaseObjectId.description:
If this item was created as a new version of another item, 
then this field include that object's OriginalBaseObjectId. 
If item wasn;t created as a new version of other objects, then this field is null. 

In other words, this field keeps Id of very first object of all versions.

browser.description: The identifier of the browser where the defect was found

reproducibility.description: The reproducibility level of the defect

foundTime.description: The time when the defect was found

EnclosureDetails.description: Specifies the changes to perform on a specific enclosure.

fieldId.description: The id of the field to update. Name of the field from the GET request

value.description:
The value to which the field will be changed. The exact type of the value depends on the field of the type:
  • String: the value as string
  • Decimal: the value as number
  • Datetime: a string defining the date and time in the following format: yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssK or yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss.fffK. The K represents optional time zone information (Z for UTC or a time zone offset). E.g.: 2018-03-15T21:42:42, 2018-03-15T21:42:42.123, 2018-03-15T21:42:42.123Z, 2018-03-15T21:42:42.123+02:00.
  • Dictionary: the id of the field value as number (or null for empty)
  • MultiChoiceDictionary: a list of numbers where each number is a field value id. E.g.: ```[1,2]``` (or [] for empty)
  • User: the user id as number (or null for empty)
  • MultiChoiceUser: a list of numbers where each number is a user id. E.g.: ```[1,2]``` (or [] for empty)
  • TimeSpan: the value of the time span as number e.g.: {"FieldId": {"Value": 4,"Unit": "Hour"}}.
  • Sprint: the id of the sprint as number (or null for empty)
  • Text: ```ApiRichText``` object, e.g.: ```{{ "html": "

    sometext

    ", "incompatibleRichTextFeatures": false}}```

FieldDetail.description: Specifies the update to perform on a specific field.

IApiRelationItemExtra.description: Holds additional, relation-specific data for one side of a relation.

longRunningTaskGuid.description:
Id of the long running task. Can be used to query the progress (see GET /System/LongOperation/{guid}). 
If empty indicates the long operation has not been started and actual result is immediately available in the Result field.

result.description: Filled only when LongRunningTaskGuid is not provided. Contains actual, immediate result of the call.

Int32ApiLongOperation.description:
Result of a REST API call that started long operation (asynchronous) to perform the actual job. 
When LongRunningTaskGuid is null this indicates a situation when REST API was able to process the task without starting asynchronous job. 
Then the actual result is returned in Result field.

html.description:
Contains the description rendered as HTML. Images are included with standard image tags.
When sending HTML to server, all images must be uploaded to the server first by posting
to ```/api/Image```. The returned URLs can then be included into the HTML.

incompatibleRichTextFeatures.description:
Indicates that rich text features are used which are not supported by the REST API,
e.g. comments. Information from the rich text might be missing in the HTML and
plain text provided by the REST API. The rich text cannot be modified via the REST API.

plainText.description: Contains the description as plain text. The plain text does not contain any formatting or images.

PublicApiRichText.description:
Contains some rich text. The rich text is provided in several different formats.
When sending rich text to the server, the rich text must be provided in exactly
one format.

If SourceFolder is provided then Name must be null, what means using the same name as name of the source folder. 
If SourceFolder is not provided then Name is required (not empty).
